description: Borrowed from Middle French tiburon, from Spanish tibur√≥n, of uncertain origin.

entries.meaning: A shark; now specifically, Sphyrna tiburo or Negaprion brevirostris.
examples: Other unlucky accidents happen in these seas to vexe them, as when (in most becalmings) they swim in the bearing Ocean, the greedy Tuberon or Shark arm'd with a double row of venemous teeth pursues them [...].
